id: T1 Fir - Fell, The tree is situated in very close proximity to the boundary fence and provides minimal amenity value. Its continued growth poses a risk of future damage to the fence and nearby property. Removal is therefore recommended to prevent structural impact and to allow appropriate space for boundary maintenance. G1 Row of Firs - Carry out a crown lift and selective pruning to achieve approximately 2-3 metres clearance from the adjacent property. These works are required to prevent encroachment, reduce the risk of branch contact with the building, and maintain safe and appropriate clearance while retaining the overall screening value of the group.

id: G1) In the south west corner. Re-reduce Spruce to approximately 30ft, removing 10ft as before on application 16/05934/TR in 2016, and reduce the line behind to the same, to lessen the wind sail effect, following an uprooting and complete failure of one of these trees on January 2024. The ground is very soft and they are exposed to very high wind. T1 Reduce large Yew and T2 Whitebeam to approximately 30ft, removing 10ft and reshape. They are generally outgrowing the domestic garden boundary. T3 Reduce and reshape the Magnolia beneath to approximately 20ft, removing 10ft, which has grown entirely weighted to the lawn side. T4 Remove up to 6x of the very long limbs over extending the lower canopy of the large Cedar tree, to reshape and rebalance the crown and clear the property as they are almost in contact. Lift to 3m by removal of lower branches. Remove snapped, snagged branches.
